meanings.sent1: The glaucous sky on a cloudy day made everything look dull.
meanings.sent2: The artist used a glaucous paint to create a serene landscape.
meanings.sent3: The glaucous cat blended perfectly with the gray sofa.
meanings.sent4: Her eyes had a glaucous tint, like the calm sea on a foggy morning.
meanings.sent5: The glaucous walls of the old castle gave it an eerie, ghostly appearance.

meanings.definition: Covered with a whitish bloom, as a grape.
meanings.sent1: The glaucous grapes in the vineyard looked ripe and ready to be picked.
meanings.sent2: The glaucous leaves of the plant indicated it needed more sunlight.
meanings.sent3: The glaucous frosting on the cake made it look like a winter wonderland.
meanings.sent4: Her glaucous skin after swimming in the pool reminded her of a mermaid.
meanings.sent5: The glaucous powder on the donuts gave them a unique, frosted appearance.
